Science Title: How a single bacterium could lead to human development . 
 Text: I was watching the documentary *The Giant Strain* and some of it dealt with how antibiotics were making us sick. The bacteria that cause the infection are living in two different species. One species produces antibiotics, which is what we all take as medicine. But there's another bacterial community growing inside your gut every time you eat anything ( think lactose intolerance, EDs) , so when these bacteria break down meat or dairy products into ammonia they can grow more easily within our guts. These new bugs eventually get cleared out completely by any antibiotic but on average there seems little effect from us. However there has been speculation that this may be due to bacteria's ability to escape their host cells. This suggests that once these expanded
